text.text_translated: Today, a lot of business happens between different countries. Most business people all over the world speak English. But the way people talk and act in business can be very different from country to country. If you do not understand these differences, people might think bad things about you. You might not understand each other, and your conversations can stop. Etiquette is the polite rules for how to act with other people. Here are three simple differences in business etiquette. This information will be very useful when you work with someone from a different country.

feedback.feedback: PASS: The feedback is exemplary. It is direct, evidence-based, and highly actionable. It clearly identifies the core issue ('Meaning Preservation Failure') and supports this claim with both a quantitative metric ('MeaningBERT score of 0.5448') and specific qualitative examples, contrasting the original phrases with the simplified ones. The suggestions for improvement are concrete and directly address the identified flaws.
